intro: Tibouchina oroensis, commonly known as the pink trumpetbush, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its striking pink or purple tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green. Tibouchina oroensis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
